feed.title: SAP Community - SAP Extended Warehouse Management
feed.subtitle: SAP Extended Warehouse Management Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: Does SAP Public Cloud WM work with Zebra MC3401 with android 13/14?
entry.content:
Hi,

I want to upgrade my scanners to the MC3401 with android 13/14. SAP only has one reference device mc9300 with android 11. To me it seems weird that it should only work on devices with android 11. My question is can I upgrade to MC3401 with android 13/14 with no problems?
EDIT: After some more digging my conclusion is that public runs on SAPGUI5 and this supports the newer android versions:
https://help.sap.com/docs/ABAP_PLATFORM_NEW/468a97775123488ab3345a0c48cadd8f/74b59efa0eef48988d3b716bd0ecc933.html?version=202210.000&locale=en-US
Because scanners use webview the scanners fall in the category of phones&tablets. 
Conclusion is that the scanner with android 13/14 will work fine with public cloud. Correct me if im wrong

entry.title: Prevent internal movement tasks from being created when a source bin already has tasks again it
entry.content:
Hi SAP,


Our warehouse team has inquired about a potential improvement opportunity that may help with accuracy and reduce human operator errors. 


The team would like to prevent internal movement tasks from being created when a source bin already has tasks again it, such as picking or putaway tasks.  We would still like to be able to create multiple picking and putaway tasks to the same location (source bin) but we wouldn’t want to be able to add internal movement tasks to a bin that is already a source bin for the other two types.


We would like to understand what is and isn’t possible with this.


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Product Substition in EWM for Kit to Order Scenario
entry.content:

I would like to know how can we configure and perform product substitution in EWM. 

Scenario - we are having sales bom and if few components are not available then would like to substitute with others from EWM. Please provide some lights if it's possible and if yes then how to achieve it or other possible solutions.

Note: I will be using product substitution with Kit-to-order scenario where I will have specific item category for components already.

Thanks,

entry.title: Upload storage bin sorting does not work /SCWM/SRTUP in some cases
entry.content:
Hello,

 

I already used the storage bin upload /SCWM/SRTUP several times for the last 3-4 years without problems.

 

Now it doesn't work anymore in some cases.

 

I created some storage bins and tried to upload the sorting.

Unfortunatly I get the following message:

Storage bin ... is not assigned to activity area ... in W

This message is kind of weird because I want to assign the activity area with the upload. Here it sounds like it is a precondition.

 

Maybe it's because of the dots in the storage bin, but I already did the sorting for that kind of storage bin in the last months and there was no update in between.

I used it for another storage bin, that is called CONTAINER 3 and it worked as expected.

 

The only thing that we changed is that with we now have Office 365.

 

Does anyone have an idea?

 

Best regards

Jonas

entry.title: Improvements to Wave Simulation Stock Checks and Logging
entry.content:
Primary Question:
How can I configure my wave simulation to account for blocked bins and restricted batches, along with available stock?

Follow-up Question:
Additionally, how can I enhance the wave simulation logs to reflect the specific reason for a shortfall (e.g., blocked bin or restricted batch) instead of only displaying product, quantity, delivery, and line information?

entry.title: Connecting a decentralized EWM to a non SAP ERP
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

We’re working on integrating a decentralized SAP EWM system with a non-SAP ERP. During GR posting, we encounter the following error: “The specified R/3 system has not been maintained in the system.”

Does anyone have suggestions on how to resolve this issue? Also, is there any documentation available on connecting decentralized EWM to a non-SAP ERP system?

Thank you in advance!

Kind regards

entry.title: HU Label Printing via Third-Party Application in S/4HANA Public Cloud EWM
entry.content:
Dear SAP Support,

 

We are working on S/4HANA Public Cloud – Extended Warehouse Management (EWM).
We have configured RF transactions for Handling Unit (HU) receiving and internal warehouse movements.

 

Our business requirement is to print HU labels using a third-party labeling solution, such as NiceLabel or Loftware, instead of directly printing from S/4HANA Public Cloud.

 

We would like to understand:

 

  1.  

  2. What standard options are available in S/4HANA Public Cloud to integrate warehouse label printing with external applications?

  3.  

  4. How we can push HU label data from S/4HANA Public Cloud to an external labeling application for printing.

 

Kindly provide guidance and recommended approach for this requirement.

Regards

 


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Customer consignment process in SAP S4HANA with EWM and TM
entry.content:
Hi All,

I have  a question regarding consignment process, we create a sales order followed by delivery creation and good issue with movement type 631. In real time scenarios how the real consumption is posted from customer ?  and how this action of consumption is posted in S4HANA?, i.e. system automatically created a sales order with logical outbound delivery and performs goods issue?

Can somebody clarify this point from business and technical point of view?

Thank you!

entry.title: Delivery document type OUTB has the wrong document category PDO
entry.content:
Hi All,

I am creating STO with in same plant with 2 different storage locations. These 2 Slocs are assigned to same warehouse. When I create deivery for the STO its getting stuck in the queue with message".

Delivery document type OUTB has the wrong document category PDOMessage No. /SCWM/ERPINTEGRATION004

Diagnosis

For the delivery, document type OUTB of category PDO was determined. However, the system was expecting document category SPC.

System Response

his message cannot be processed.

Procedure

Contact the system administration.

Procedure for System Administration

Change the determination of the document type ( Map Document Types from ERP Systemto WM System )."

I thought its standard procedure but wonder thing with same data I am able to post in Sandbox and delivery is distrubuting to EWM system without any error.

There is no confirguation in sandbox with SPC document category and configuration is same as development.

Could you please let me know if I am missing anything or any BC need to activate for this.

Regards,

Chand.

entry.title: Limitation in SAP RFID Handling unit number series Length
entry.content:
We have integration between a third party RFID solution with SAP. The challenge is with the Handling unit number series length:

 

  • The Third Party RFID solution supports 28 character length
  • SAP HU number series is restricted to a maximum of character length.

 

This limitation is causing integration issues. we need feasible solution or workaround where the HU numbers from the third-party RFID can be aligned with SAP. Request your urgent guidance as this is very critical for our go live.

 


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: How the capacity planning works in warehouse management (public cloud)?
entry.content:
Dear Experts,

Could you please explain how capacity planning functions in warehouse management within SAP Public Cloud?

The client’s requirement involves handling two types of storage bins:

  • Storage bin with a capacity of 1.0 TO

  • Storage bin with a capacity of 1.5 TO

There is a material called SS wire roll, which is procured from different suppliers and varies in weight. Using batch-specific units of measure during synchronous goods receipt, the process is as follows:

  • Material with a weight less than or equal to 1.0 TO should be placed in a 1.0 TO bin.

  • Material with a weight greater than 1.0 TO but less than or equal to 1.5 TO should be stored in a 1.5 TO bin

Additionally, if all 1.0 TO bins are full, materials weighing less than or equal to 1.0 TO may need to be placed in a 1.5 TO bin, with up to 4 quantities per bin depending on their size.

 

How the process can be mapped in sap public cloud warehouse management? please advise me on priority.

entry.title: Issue with Batch-Specific UOM Quantity Display in Warehouse Monitor vs MMBE in SAP Public Cloud.
entry.content:
Dear Experts,

While receiving material with batch-specific UOM through synchronous goods receipt in Warehouse Management in SAP Public Cloud, I observed an issue.

The base UOM for the material is TO, and the alternative UOM is EA. I am receiving the material in EA with a batch-specific UOM ratio, where each EA is considered as a handling unit. However, when I check the received quantity in the Warehouse Monitor app, the EA is displayed according to the batch-specific UOM ratio instead of reflecting the actual received quantity in EA.

On the other hand, when I check in MMBE, the receiving quantity is displayed correctly.

Could you please advise on the reason for this discrepancy and the possible resolution?

entry.title: Issue with Batch-Specific UOM Quantity Display in Warehouse Monitor vs MMBE in SAP Public Cloud.

For reference i have attached some images - Please review.

entry.title: SAP Public cloud and Warehouse bin migration object
entry.content:
Hi,

Is creation of warehouse bins supported in SAP Public Cloud with migration objects or is it supposed to update existing bin data_

Warehouse storage bin | SAP Help Portal

In the documentation it says is should be possible to create bins, but we are getting error You cannot create new object in wh...

In migration object template, there is information Note that the storage bin must already exist. 

When the bin already exists in system, and then try to update them,  we are getting error Storage bin already exists.., 

So which function the warehouse bin migration object supports_

entry.title: enable barcode for Serial ID on RF screen
entry.content:
Hello Everyone,

We have a requirement to enable Barcode for Serial ID field in Bin-to-Bin scenario. Upon scanning the barcode string, Serial ID need be decoded so that it gets added as new line item to the scanned List.

This way business will get to know how many serial Ids are scanned.

 FM - /SCWM/RF_XSERNR_PAI gets triggered when you enter Serial Id manually or when 2D barcode string is entered in Input field.

It is working when we enter Serial ID manually hit enter.  Serial ID gets add to the scanned list as below.

In the standard RF screen, Serial ID field is just declared of type Input/Output. We have created custom screen and enabled property Barcode = 'TRUE' and checked it as scrollable. default length made it as 255, output as 18.

As we declared output length as 18 and we are passing input as 2D barcode string, ABAP dump is raised with message ‘Output field too short for converted value’ because of the SERIAL ID conversion exit routine.

Dump says System is expecting plain Serial ID as an input. We validated BADI - /SCWM/EX_BARC_DECODE but it is not triggering in our case.

FYI - Conversion routine is triggered before PAI FM is triggered.

Expectation – We are looking for BADI or Enhancement before Routine where we can write custom logic to decode the barcode string and pass Serial Id as input (like we are currently entering manually).

I just wanted to check if anyone has worked on similar kind of requirement.

RF menu Path - 050205, Logical transaction -AHPRTO, step - XSERNR

 

Thank you.

Regards,

Karthik

entry.title: SAP EWM process codes and its language
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

we are configured/using Process codes(as Z*) to stop PGI, if they are having any defect in DO items. We are created new program and assigned to EWM monitor as new node.. Now the program working fine as per expected functionality... Here the problem is with data stored in table level and its Language dependency..

Ex: My client login with Japanese language and using this codes (with description Japanese) and store it in DB .. when he again  login with EN .. he want to see the same descriptions in EN.... Please do the needful.

Best Regards,

Gowrisankar
